alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lawrence (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:29AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lawrence and Jackson Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1228 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Bedford, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownstown. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 37 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for central, south central and southeastern Indiana.
